entry.title: Re: Invalid character/Bad Character removal in BW4HANA using AMDP Class
entry.content:
Hi Lakshminarasimhan

 

The usage of [:print:] might cause a problem if the loaded data contains non-latin characters  like:

  • japanese
  • chinese
  • cyrillic
  • etc

So this:

SELECT
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T1" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T1,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T2" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T2,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T3" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T3,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T4" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T4
FROM ( SELECT
'Á•ù‰Ω†‰ªäÂ§©ÊÑâÂø´ Aabc123' as T1,
'–ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è! Aabc123' as T2,
'ËâØ„ÅÑ‰∏ÄÊó•„Çí Aabc123' as T3,
'Have a nice day Aabc123' as T4
FROM dummy)

has the effect, that every which are non-latin characters will be also removed.

 

See the KBA:

3386808 Unexpected result when replace_regexpr and :PRINT: is used in a HANA transformation

 

Br,

Roland

entry.title: SAC Rapid Finance (S/4HC Public, 2FM / guide 2JV) ‚Äî Actuals OK, but Copy‚ÜíPlan writes 0 and Ca
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôre deploying SAP Analytics Cloud Rapid Finance on S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. We followed configuration guide 2JV and have scope item 2FM active.

Environment

  • S/4: Public Edition (2FM active)

  • SAC content/model: SAP_FI_FPA_S4_Finance_Planning (FPA1 / H1)

  • Versions: public.Actual (OK), public.Plan (targets)

  • CoA: YCOA master; YBSE is an alternative CoA (no hierarchy in S/4)

  • Org master: No hierarchies for Cost Center/Profit Center/Functional Area (leafs only)

What works

  • Actuals import runs and we can report Actuals in SAC (P&L/BS).

Issues

  1. Copy Actuals ‚Üí Plan (delivered step) runs but writes 0 to Plan.

  2. Cash Flow (Indirect) doesn‚Äôt populate the 13 CF lines. We added the CF accounts in SAC.

  3. GLAccountBalanceFlow import finishes, but ~30% rows are rejected.

What we already did

  • Account dimension: Exported, then manually mapped ACCTYPEand Rate Type (Closing/Average) because S/4 account types (e.g., X, P‚Ä¶) didn‚Äôt map 1:1.

  • Added 13 CF holder accounts in SAC (all ACCTYPE=EXP, RateType=Average):
    1000100, 1000210, 1000310, 1000320, 1000330, 1000350, 1000360, 2000111, 2000210, 2000400, 3000100, 3000200, 3000300.
    Initially not in a hierarchy; we then adjusted our AFL to reference them directly to avoid compile errors‚Äîstill no CF values written.

  • Copy AFL (simplified) tried in addition to delivered step (uses target version‚Äôs Start/End date, includes # members or removes org dims, writes to AUDIT_TRAIL="SAC"):

CONFIG.HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT].[h/H1]
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
MEMBERSET [d/AUDIT_TRAIL] = "SAC"
MEMBERSET [d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT] = BASEMEMBER([d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT].[h/H1], "FPA1/08","FPA1/00ASSETS","FPA1/00LIABILITS")
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version]="public.Actual")

  • GLAccountBalanceFlow query (for the Finance model import) - typical filters used:

    • Controlling Area = A000

    • Ledger = 0L

    • GLAcct Type Flow = PLCHANGING; ‚Ä¶

    • Fiscal Period = 1 ‚Üí 12

    • Fiscal Year of Ledger = 2025
      Job finishes, but the monitor shows a high ‚ÄúRejected‚Äù count.

Questions for the community

  1. Copy step writing 0: common causes in Rapid Finance? (e.g., version not in Edit, publish/locks, AuditTrail choice, required Measures, missing # in org dims, etc.)

  2. Cash-Flow (Indirect):

    • Must the 13 CF holder accounts be in H1 under specific parents, or is ‚Äúexisting as leafs‚Äù enough?

    • Are ACCTYPE=EXP and RateType=Average the expected properties for these CF lines?

  3. GLAccountBalanceFlow rejections (~30%): Where do you typically find the root cause? (dimension validation, account attributes, currency/rate-type, hierarchy assumptions‚Ä¶) Any checklist?

  4. Any official mapping guidance from S/4 account type codes (X, P, etc.) to SAC ACCTYPE and Rate Type used by Rapid Finance?

  5. With YCOA master and YBSE alternative (no S/4 hierarchies), are there extra steps needed so Rapid Finance acts like the content expects?

Evidence I can attach

  • Import run log (showing ‚ÄúRejected‚Äù rows)

  • GLAccountBalanceFlow filter screenshot

  • FPA1/H1 snippet + CF accounts list

  • Data Action run screenshots and AFL snippets

Any pointers or a working checklist would be hugely appreciated. Thanks!

Axel Mutombo

entry.title: Re: S/4 Cloud: Local Event Consumption not getting triggered

Hi @yoppy_santoso1,

I raised an incident for this. SAP then reactivated the corresponding RAP behavior definition, then it worked. Unfortunately you cannot do this yourself, since it is an SAP standard object (at least I don't know any way to do it without getting an authorization error in eclipse during activation). You might also try to just bring your implementation to your test system, maybe the issue is only on dev (even though this is not nice, but if you want to speed things up, it might be worth a try). If you raise an incident, you could tell SAP that they found a solution for this in incident nr. 815224/2025 (maybe that helps speeding things up as well). Of course I can't know if really have the same issue as we had.

Best regards
Daniel

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformation
entry.content:
Key Highlights

  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition 2025.
  • New Custom Code Migration capabilities accelerate the transformation of classic ERP code to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, including:
    • Documentation Chat - Get accurate answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications.
    • ABAP Program Explain - Understand the business purpose and logic of legacy code.
    • Explain for SAP S/4HANA Test Cockpit Issues - Diagnose and resolve S/4HANA-related Test Cockpit issues using context from simplification items and cookbooks.

Earlier this year, SAP introduced Joule for Developers ‚Äî a set of embedded artificial intelligence capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP, that helps developers accelerate application and extension development, reduce costs, and boost productivity.

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, version 2025, providing comprehensive support for ABAP Cloud use cases. The release also introduces the first Custom Code Migration capabilities, bringing a powerful suite of AI-assisted capabilities purpose-built for ABAP development and cloud delivery.

Best of all, Joule for Developers remains free of charge, enabling customers and partners to integrate it into daily operations and accelerate innovation without commercial barriers.

 

What‚Äôs Included

This release for Private Cloud delivers AI-powered support for the core development scenarios ABAP developers rely on every day. Key capabilities include:

  • inline code completion,
  • ABAP/CDS code explanation,
  • automated unit test generation for ABAP and ABAP core data services (CDS),
  • RAP business objects generation,
  • RAP predictive business logic, and
  • OData consumption.

All capabilities are designed to accelerate development, improve code quality, and boost productivity from day one. Additionally, this release introduces the first wave of Custom Code Migration capabilities, designed to accelerate the move from classic SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Cloud Edition. These AI-powered features simplify code analysis and adaptation by:

  • Providing Documentation Chat for quick answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications:

 

  • Using ABAP Program Explain to clarify the business purpose and implementation logic of legacy code:

 

  • Explaining ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) findings with step-by-step guidance on how to fix the issues, based on simplification items and technical documentation:

 

All capabilities are designed to reduce manual effort, speed up migration projects, and help your teams to modernize their ABAP landscapes with great confidence.

The ABAP AI software development kit, powered by Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management, is now available and offers centralized access to the generative AI hub in SAP AI Core. It leverages the same robust platform SAP uses internally, delivering proven, production-grade infrastructure to customer landscapes. With simplified configuration and governance, development teams can adopt AI capabilities quickly, providing a significant boost to integration efforts.

 

Why This Matters

Private cloud customers require strict governance, security, and operational control - yet they also seek the speed and innovation modern AI-driven development delivers. This release addresses both priorities by enabling:

  • faster development cycles with AI-assisted coding and test generation,
  • stronger knowledge transfer through automated code explanations and copilot interactions,
  • higher delivery quality with automated testing and code migration support, and
  • secure innovation within controlled environments.

 

Looking Ahead

We‚Äôre building on this momentum with a series of targeted deliveries aligned to upcoming releases across the BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Planned updates for BTP ABAP Environment 2511, 2602, and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 include:

  • documentation generation capabilities,
  • enhanced explanations for reports in the Custom Code Migration application,
  • AI-enabled insights on Clean Core‚Äìrelated ATC findings directly within the Custom Code Migration application,
  • code migration and adaptation proposals to support developers working on RISE code adaptation,
  • ABAP CDS annotation and metadata extension generation, and
  • ABAP CDS analytical model generation.

These enhancements will extend Joule‚Äôs impact beyond code completion and test generation, supporting documentation, migration and Clean Core compliance, analytical use cases, and addressing more stages of the end-to-end development lifecycle.

 

Free Offer Extended

SAP Joule for Developers will remain free of charge. The extended promotion ensures that all customers and partners can continue to use Joule for Developers capabilities for free.

Access can be requested using the material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer now extends beyond the BTP ABAP environment and SAP Cloud ERP Public Edition to include SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition customers running the latest 2025 release.

 

Closing Remarks

SAP Joule for Developers‚Äô delivery for Private Cloud is a significant milestone ‚Äî combining end-to-end ABAP Cloud with AI use cases, innovative code migration scenarios, and a standardized ABAP AI SDK to bring practical AI assistance directly into everyday development workflows.

With extended free of charge access, we invite every customer and partner to explore SAP Joule for Developers, push its boundaries, and help shape the future of AI-assisted ABAP development.

Start using SAP Joule for Developers today and join us in building the next generation of intelligent, AI-driven ABAP innovation.

For a deeper dive, read the blog post by Simona Marincei, head of ABAP AI.

Learn more about SAP Joule for Developers capabilities here.

entry.title: Re: SAP certificate renewal - practical guide
entry.content:
Hi @DurgaKalyan1 

the updated certificate should be provided by the holder of the private key, ie. the party with which you communicate. The public certificate is used to encrypt the message or to verify signature. The private key is used to decrypt the message or to sign. So if your communication partner is decrypting your messages, it should provide you with the certificate.

Nevertheless, this is a reverse scenario to one I was describing in the blog. The blog is about when you are the owner of the private part of the certificate, like in the case of the SAP certificate.

In your case, your partner should inform you about the certificate exchange in time and provide you with the new certificate. You can send them this blog üôÇ

entry.title: Automating Job Requisition Creation Without Middleware
entry.content:
In this article, I‚Äôll walk you through how to automate job requisition creation in SAP SuccessFactors‚Äîwithout relying on any middleware solutions. By leveraging Intelligence Services Center (ISC) and Integration Center, we can streamline the process and reduce dependency on external systems.

Key Events Used in ISC:

  1. Update a Position
  2. New Position

These events allow us to trigger requisition creation automatically. Depending on the business need, you can configure the system to generate either:

  • Approved Requisitions: Set IsDraft = false and ensure all mandatory fields are populated.
  • Pre-Approved Requisitions: Set IsDraft = true and map relevant position attributes.

Process Overview:

Process 1:
When a new position is created in the system, the Intelligent Services Center (ISC) event is automatically triggered. This event initiates the integration flow, which seamlessly creates the corresponding job requisition‚Äîno middleware is required for this process.

To implement this automation, we need to create an integration specifically for the ISC event: New Position.

Steps to Create the Integration:

  1. Navigate to Integration Center in your SAP SuccessFactors instance.
  2. Click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù to start a new integration.
  3. Select ‚ÄúMore Integration Types‚Äù to access additional integration templates.
  4. Choose the appropriate template or start from scratch, depending on your requirements.
  5. Configure the integration to listen for the New Position ISC event and define the logic to create a job requisition accordingly.

Now, set the Trigger Type to Intelligent Services.
For both the Source Type and Destination Type, select SuccessFactors.
Ensure the Format is set to OData.

After clicking on create button, select the intelligent service as shown below.

 

Selecting the Appropriate ISC Event and Configuring the Integration

  • If the integration should automatically create a job requisition whenever a new position is created, select the ISC event: ‚ÄúNew Position‚Äù.
  • If the integration should trigger when an existing position is updated, select the ISC event: ‚ÄúUpdate to a Position‚Äù.

Once the appropriate Intelligent Services event is selected:

  1. The Source Type will automatically be set to Position.
  2. Next, define the Destination system (SuccessFactors).
  3. Proceed to map the required entities and fields between the source and destination to ensure accurate data flow.

Select the Destination type as Job requisition

Now, proceed to map the necessary fields from the Position object to the Job Requisition object.
This step ensures that all relevant data from the position is accurately transferred to the requisition during the integration process.

Mandatory Job Requisition Fields and Their Values

The following fields in the Job Requisition entity must be populated during integration to ensure successful creation:

S.No

Field

Value

Condition/Notes

1

Application Template ID

Template ID

Must match the ID defined in the Job Requisition template.

2

Internal Status

0 for Pre-Approved
1 for Approved

Determines the initial approval status of the requisition.

3

Application Status Set ID

Status Set ID

Should align with the status set configured in the Job Requisition template.

4

Template ID

Requisition Template ID

Must correspond to the correct Job Requisition template.

5

IsDraft

True ‚Äì for Pre-Approved
False ‚Äì for Approved

If set to False, ensure all mandatory fields are mapped and populated.

 

Map the required fields between the Position and Job Requisition entities as outlined below:

S.No

Field Type

Mapping

1

Object

Position_object.externalCode ‚Üí JobReq_object.externalCode

2

Picklist

Position_picklist.optionID ‚Üí JobReq_picklist.ID (type: int64)

3

String

Position_field ‚Üí JobReq_field

After completing the field mapping between the Position and Job Requisition entities, apply a filter based on the "To Be Hired" flag.

  • This filter ensures that the integration only triggers for positions marked as eligible for hiring.
  • By adding this condition, the system will create job requisitions only for positions where the "To Be Hired" flag is enabled.

Once the filter is configured:

  1. Validate the integration setup to ensure all mappings and conditions are correctly defined.
  2. Click Save to finalize and activate the integration.

 

Solution :

To trigger the integration and automatically create a job requisition:

  • Create a new position either through the Position Org Chart or by importing data.
  • Once the position is created and meets the defined criteria (e.g., To Be Hired flag is enabled), the integration will automatically generate the corresponding Job Requisition.


Role Assignment and Route Map Configuration in Job Requisition

In the Job Requisition, roles can be dynamically assigned using Save Rules. Based on these rules, the Route Map is automatically updated to reflect the appropriate users involved in the approval and hiring process.

Extending the Same Logic to ISC Event: "Update to a Position"

Similarly, you can configure the Intelligent Services event: ‚ÄúUpdate to a Position‚Äù to trigger the integration.

  • Whenever this event is raised (e.g., due to a change in position details), the integration will execute and automatically create or update the Job Requisition based on the updated position data.
  • This ensures that any significant changes to an existing position‚Äîsuch as a change in department, location, or hiring need‚Äîcan seamlessly initiate the requisition process without manual intervention.

 

Automating Job Requisition Creation Using Intelligent Services and Integration Center

By leveraging the Intelligent Services Center (ISC) and Integration Center, you can automate the creation of Job Requisitions based on updates to Position details and predefined default values.

Additionally, if your organization uses multiple Job Requisition templates, you can utilize lookup tables within Integration Center to dynamically select the appropriate template. This can be achieved by configuring conditional logic based on specific Position field values.

 For example:

  • If Position.Department,Input code = "Sales", use Template Output code -XXX
  • If Position.Department.Input code = "Service", use Template Output code -YYY

This approach ensures that the correct requisition template is applied automatically, improving accuracy and reducing manual effort.



SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting

entry.title: How to assign storage process for Manually created HU in inbound
entry.content:
Hello EWM team,

I would need some suggestion on having storage process in EWM.

Scenario: (System WD4)

Plant A - During receiving, we will pack the material with auto pack & that HU will get packspec & Storage process assigned. So, that HU is activated for storage control with storage process. (attached screen)
After receiving, while creating putaway task - this will be HU task.

Plant B - During receiving, we will pack the material with external number & manually. So, this HU will not get storage process assigned. (attached screen) Hence when creating putaway task - this will be product warehouse task. 

Now, in order to have intermediate step in plant B before doing putaway to final bin - How can I assign storage process to HU (which is manually created)?
If not possible, is there a way that I can achieve bringing intermediate step (taking material to other work center) before doing putaway to final bin?
I request you to suggest me please, your suggestion is really helpful

Dear tsuuuu,

to change the description (and legend) of measures you need to

  1. define two restricted measures in your story (one for previous year, one for actual year)

  3. use the text of the calculation input control for the measure description

As a result you have two calculation input controls influencing the description of each measure dynamically:

entry.title: Error while subscribing to SAP BUILD APPS and SAP BPA in trail account
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: S/4 HANA Public Cloud_How to configure the process te...
entry.content:
Hello @lea_hanh 

The Process Template in Manage Mass Maintenance ‚Äì Business Partners (New) is sourced from MDG Mass Processing in S4HANA Public Cloud.

If the list is empty and the Start button is disabled, it indicates either that no MDG configuration has been set up yet or that your role/scope is incomplete.

What should you do?

Authorisations
Make sure your role includes the catalogues for: Manage Mass Maintenance ‚Äì Business Partners (New), and MDG Mass Processing (Version 2) (app F1686A).
Check catalogues in the Fiori Apps Library and add them to Maintain Business Roles.

Create/activate a template in MDG
Open MDG Mass Processing (Version 2) ‚Üí Create a Configuration for the Business Partner object (for example, Address change), select the fields, then save and activate it. This configuration will then be available as a Process Template in your BP mass project.

Go back to Manage Mass Maintenance ‚Äì Business Partners (New), create the project, pick your template, and start. 

If the dropdown remains empty after an upgrade,
this specific issue is documented for 2508: see KBA 3663145 and KBA 3122300. Follow the guidance on successor apps and template visibility.

SAP Support Portal-3663145 - No Process Template shown when creating Mass Maintenance Process after 2508 upgrade

SAP Support Portal-3122300 - How to Perform Mass Changes to Customer/Supplier Business Partners in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Tip for ABAPers Working with Door Assignment in SAP EWM
entry.content:
If you ever need to change or reassign the Door (Destination Bin) on a Warehouse Task (WT) in an EWM system, here are two standard approaches depending on your business requirement.

1. Change Door and Confirm the WT

If your requirement is to change the door and immediately confirm the WT (data will then be stored in /SCWM/ORDIM_C),
you can use the standard function module: /SCWM/TO_CONFIRM

Make sure to fill the table parameter IT_CONF_EXC with the exception code CHBD (Change Bin),
along with the corresponding BUSCON and EXEC_STEP, which you can verify from SPRO configuration.

Example:
ls_conf_exc-exccode = 'CHBD'.
ls_conf_exc-buscon = 'TPT'.
ls_conf_exc-exec_step = '04'.

2. Change Door and Keep the WT Open

If you need to reassign or correct the door but want to keep the WT status OPEN (data remains in /SCWM/ORDIM_O),
you can use another standard function module: /SCWM/TO_CHANGE_ATT_UPD

This FM allows updating certain WT attributes ‚Äî including the destination bin (door) ‚Äî without confirming or recreating the task.

Summary:

ScenarioFunction ModuleWT Status AfterData Saved In
Change door + confirm/SCWM/TO_CONFIRMConfirmed/SCWM/ORDIM_C
Change door but keep open/SCWM/TO_CHANGE_ATT_UPDStill open/SCWM/ORDIM_O

Hope this helps anyone working on EWM Door Assignment adjustments from ABAP!

Best Regards, 
Rosyad

entry.title: SAP MDG: Auto-fill CR Description by Data Model and CR Type Description
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

BADI Responsible: USMD_CREQUEST_INTEGRATION.

Auto-populate the Change Request Description with the Data Model‚Äôs CR Type Description so every MDG CR is consistently and meaningfully described. 

Create Custom implementation & assign Data model filter values.

Method Responsible: if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

Code: 

METHOD if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

    SELECT SINGLE a~usmd_creq_type, a~usmd_model,  b~txtmi        
             FROM usmd110c AS a INNER JOIN
                  usmd110t AS b ON a~usmd_creq_type = b~usmd_creq_type
                               AND a~usmd_model EQ @iv_model
             INTO  @DATA(ls_cr_types)
            WHERE b~langu      EQ @SY-langu AND
                  a~usmd_creq_type = @iv_crequest_type.

    IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
      cv_description = ls_cr_types-txtmi.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.

entry.title: SAP SF Onboarding External User First Access Language
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are currently implementing SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, integrated with Recruiting Management, and we‚Äôve come across a confusing and possibly conflicting behaviour regarding locale (language) handling for external new hires.

According to the official SAP documentation ‚Äî KBA 2997807: How does locale work for External New Hires? ‚Äî when Onboarding is initiated from Recruiting, the locale selected by the candidate during the creation of their candidate profile is automatically passed to Onboarding. The KBA further states that if the defaultLocale field is mapped via HRIS-sync, that value will override the candidate‚Äôs own locale.

‚ÄúThe locale for the external new hire will be updated automatically when you initiate the onboarding process from Recruiting Management. The locale provided by the candidate at the time of candidate profile creation is published by Recruiting Management and the same is consumed by Onboarding. If you also provide any mapping for the defaultLocale field under the data model (HRIS-sync mapping), then that value overrides the locale value that is selected by the new hire as part of the candidate profile.‚Äù

However, another document ‚Äî KBA 3115662: Considerations when syncing defaultLocale from Employee Central to Onboarding ‚Äî explicitly advises against syncing the defaultLocale field between EC and Onboarding, as this can lead to synchronization issues and unexpected behaviour. This recommendation directly contradicts the approach described in KBA 2997807.

There currently seems to be no clean, end-to-end solution ensuring that the language preference defined by the candidate is respected across Recruiting ‚Üí Onboarding ‚Üí EC. From an implementation perspective, this feels like a product gap, since the expected multilingual user experience (especially for first login/reset password screens) depends on these inconsistent behaviours.

Has anyone else encountered this situation or found a stable configuration that ensures consistent locale handling across modules?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

Nat√°lie

entry.title: Event-Based Revenue Recognition: Two Options for Considering Write-Offs During Re-Evaluation
entry.content:
With the release S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502 SAP introduced enhanced flexibility in Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR) for billing elements using revenue recognition keys SPTM and SPTMWP. Specifically, users now have two distinct options for how write-offs are considered during re-evaluation. 

 

Option 1: Default Logic for Considering Write-Offs

By default, re-evaluation only considers write-offs that were posted within or prior to the fiscal period in which the re-evaluation occurs. This logic is active out-of-the-box in the S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Example scenario:

  1. Time allocation or relevant cost postings occur in fiscal period N
  2. Write-off is posted in fiscal period N+1, referencing costs from fiscal period N
  3. The write-off is not considered during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N
  4. The write-off is recognized during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N+1

This approach ensures that only finalized financial data within the current or earlier periods influences revenue recognition.

 

Option 2: Re-Evaluation Considering Future Write-Offs

Alternatively, re-evaluation can be configured to consider all write-offs, including those posted in future periods, as long as they reference billing element items created within or before the current fiscal period.

This option is not active by default and must be enabled via expert configuration. Once activated, it applies system-wide and cannot be limited to specific objects.

To request this configuration, submit a customer incident under the component: CO-PC-OBJ-EBR-2CL

Example scenario:

  1. Time allocation or relevant cost posting occurs in fiscal period N
  2. Billing document is issued in fiscal period N
  3. Write-off is posted in fiscal period N+1, referencing costs from fiscal period N
  4. The future write-off is recognized during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N

This approach allows for more proactive revenue adjustments, even when write-offs are posted after the initial billing period.

 

When is Re-Evaluation Triggered?

Re-evaluation in EBRR is initiated through either of the following apps:

  • F4277 ‚Äì Run Revenue Recognition ‚Äì Projects
  • F4767 ‚Äì Event-Based Revenue Recognition ‚Äì Projects

These apps assess posted data and adjust revenue recognition accordingly, including the treatment of write-offs.

entry.title: Re: Implementing a Dynamic YTD Filter Up to Yesterday in...
entry.content:
Dear Moritz,

I am not sure, if you are using a date field with day granularity in your model. If you do so, you could use the option to set an own current date variable (for instance, when you create your first restricted measure:

Then, you need to uncheck the system current date check box, so the "current date" is not derived by the system date:

After that you need to insert the following code to automatically update the Current Date on page initialization:

// set current date variable
var yesterday = new Date();
yesterday.setDate(yesterday.getDate() - 1);


// convert date to CurrentDateTime
Application.setCurrentDateTime(
    CurrentDateTime.createCalendarDateTime({
        granularity: CalendarTimeGranularity.Day,
		day: yesterday.getDate(),
        month: yesterday.getMonth()+1, // month is indexed 0-11
        year: yesterday.getFullYear()
    })
);

It will auto update the current date to yesterday. You could use the current date for all your measures.

Kind regards,

Tano

entry.title: Shaping the Future of Utilities Together: Advisory Customer Council for Utilities 2025
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-evolving world, success is built on connection. When great minds come together, we unlock the power to shape the future together. That spirit of collaboration was at the heart of the Advisory Customer Council for Utilities (ACCU), held on October 1‚Äì2, 2025 in Walldorf. This exclusive forum brought together senior executives from leading utility companies and SAP leadership for two days of strategic dialogue, innovation, and co-creation.

A Forum for Strategic Engagement

The ACCU is more than just a meeting,  it's a platform for trusted exchange, visionary thinking, and shaping the future of SAP‚Äôs solutions for the utilities sector. This exclusive forum fosters alignment on industry priorities and enables participants to influence SAP‚Äôs roadmap in a meaningful way.

Highlights from the Event

We kicked off with a warm and engaging get-together on Day 0, setting the tone for a productive and inspiring agenda. Over the next two days, we heard powerful customer stories from Zelestra, BC Hydro, and E.ON, each offering unique perspectives and insights into their transformation journeys.

SAP leaders shared updates on key topics including:

  • Clean Core
  • SAP Business Technology Platform (BDC)
  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Customer Support & Experience
  • Move to the Cloud
  • Asset Management
  • Distributed Energy Resources

These sessions sparked valuable discussions and reinforced our shared commitment to innovation and excellence.

A Special Moment

A standout moment of the event was the participation of SAP CEO Christian Klein, who joined us for an open conversation. His presence and clear commitment to the utilities industry underscored SAP‚Äôs dedication to supporting our customers through this era of transformation.

Experiencing Innovation Firsthand

Participants had the opportunity to visit the SAP Experience Center, where we showcased the SAP Energy Park, a space that highlights SAP as a living example of sustainability in action. Through interactive exhibits and hands-on demonstrations, participants discovered how SAP‚Äôs latest solutions are driving the transition to net zero, bringing the future of utilities to life in a dynamic and inspiring environment.

Looking Ahead

We extend our heartfelt thanks to all our customers for their trust, insights, and active participation. Your voices are instrumental in shaping the future of SAP‚Äôs utilities solutions. We look forward to continuing this journey together‚Äîco-innovating, collaborating, and leading the way into the next era of utilities.

entry.title: Re: The installation of SAP products failed with 5 error(s)
entry.content: Hello! It‚Äôs been a while since you posted were you able to resolve it? I ran into the same issue and wanted to share what fixed it for me. The problem was fonts: exceptions were caused by user-installed fonts rather than the system defaults. If you remove the user-installed fonts, delete the SAP-related folders, and then reinstall SAP GUI, it should be resolved.

entry.title: Re: WHEN CREATING A NEW CARD, NOT ALL MDF SUCCESSFACTORS...
entry.content:
Hi Jhonatan,

Please see https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/implementing-metadata-framework-mdf/mdf-configurations-for-latest-people-profile?locale=en-US

There can be few reason why a MDF object does not show up in the list 

1. The object you are trying to add is already as card into one or other category 

2. If the object is pre-delivered 

3. If object has more than 2 level of composite (parent + child + grand child is allowed) those are not allowed 

Please help check if it is due to any of these reasons.

Regards,

-Narendra

{"error":{"code":"bpm.workflowruntime.rest.user.not.sufficient.privileges","message":"User does not have sufficient privileges.","logId":"40ff78b6-14e4-40fa-91ec-17d6afe-ap21"}}

thanks !

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Hi folks,

SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now also available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025.
The ABAP AI license materials for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 are the same as for SAP BTP ABAP Environment & SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. For more information, please check out the following SAP Note 3571857.

Below, you can find a step-by-step guide on how to activate SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 system.

Have fun and stay tuned for TechEd soon!

Best,
Sebastian

 

Prerequisites

You have a customer account on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and a development system on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and you have prepared the following:

  • Subscription to SAP Cloud Identity Services
  • Subscription to SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • Established trust to your SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant in your BTP Subaccount, see this link
  • Your user needs Administrator access to your SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant
  • Your system needs to be configured so that it trusts server certificates according to the "required" section of the BTP Trust Store.
  • Your system needs to use a client certificate issued by a CA listed in the "required" section of the BTP Trust Store. One way to obtain a client certificate can be found on Manage Destination Certificates (under "Generate a Certificate").
  • You've successfully applied SAP Note 3627794 .
  • Your ABAP system needs to support TLS 1.3. If TLS 1.3 is not enabled, refer to SAP Note 3318423  to activate it.

 

Configuration steps in your SAP BTP subaccount

  1. In your BTP subaccount, navigate to Entitlements. You‚Äôll see a table with all entitlements it already has.
  2. Select Configure Entitlements > Add Service Plans. A popover appears with all entitlements available for your directory/subaccount.
  3. Select the service SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities and then the plan ‚Äúdefault‚Äù
  4. Select the amount of quota
  5. Select Add Service Plans.
  6. Select Save.

 

  1. Navigate to your subaccount in the SAP BTP cockpit
  2. Go to Services > Service Marketplace.
  3. Choose the SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities tile.
  4. Choose Create and select Plan default




  5. Once the service is created, go to your IAS and navigate to Users & Authorizations > Groups
  6. Check that the group j4d-admin was successfully created
  7. Add your admin user to the created j4a-admin group

     

  8. Navigate to your subaccount in the SAP BTP cockpit
  9. In the navigation go to Services >Instances & Subscriptions
  10. Choose the SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities tile.
  11. Click on Go to Application




  12. Maintain Certificate Mappings app should be opened



    Configuration in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 system

    1. Go to your ABAP system, open the transaction APPLDESTCC
    2. Select scenario HTTP - Application Destination and click on Execute


    3. Next, select AIC_ADT_HTTP_PROXY and open the context menu. Choose Create New Application Destination. Now, you're asked to enter the details of your application destination.


       



    4. Enter an Application Destination Name of your choice and select the check mark. 



    5. Now, first enter a Description and select the checkboxes Active and Default.

    6. Fill in the information in the Technical Settings tab:
      1. Target System Settings: In the Host field, enter https://proxy.<your region>.hub.j4a.services.sap. As Protocol, select HTTPS.
      2. (Optional) HTTP Proxy Options: This information is not mandatory.

        Note The region you enter in https://proxy.<your region>.hub.j4a.services.sap must be the same region (not technical key) that you chose for your subaccount, for example "eu10". See Regions and API Endpoints for the ABAP Environment


         

    7. Choose the Logon tab
      1. General Settings: Select Connection to External Server.
      2. Logon Procedure: Select Client Certificate and choose the certificate you wish to use from the dropdown menu
      3. Select Save. You've successfully maintained the connection.

         

    8. Now, continue in your subaccount in the SAP BTP Cockpit
      1. Select the SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities subscription you have just created (see Subscribing to SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities), or open its details and select Go to Application. You are forwarded to the Maintain Certificate Mappings page.
      2. In the Certificate Mappings section, select Create to receive a one-time password (OTP).
      3. Copy the OTP.

        Note: the OTP is valid for five minutes. If you need a new one, close the pop-up and click on Create again.


    9.  Go to your corresponding ABAP system and run report AIC_ADT_PROXY_CERTIFICATE. Select Execute.
      1. Paste the one-time password that you've copied in the previous step
      2. (Optional) If you wish to use a new certificate that you haven't used in step 1, select Use Custom SSL Client PSE ID. Click in the Client PSE ID field and choose the new certificate from the value help. Now, you can go back to step 1 and switch to the new certificate.
      3. Select Execute



      4. You've successfully registered your certificate!




         

 You can now create a new ABAP Project in ADT (using its latest version) and check out SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities

entry.title: SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition, 2025 FPS00 ‚Äì What‚Äôs New
entry.content:
We have recently released the latest updates for SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition, 2025 FPS00. With this release, we further expand the AI capabilities available for SAP EWM, add in more functionalities and scenarios for the Advanced Shipping & Receiving integration, deliver a host of extensibility and user experience improvements, improve the Quality Management and Production integrations, and much more.

ADVANCED SHIPPING & RECEIVING

Integration between transportation and warehouse logistics is a significant contributor towards logistics efficiency, synchronizing process changes between warehouse and transportation, reducing overall logistics-costs by optimizing and streamlining freight planning with warehouse execution. To further tighten this integration, with this release we provide the following enhancements and updates to Advanced Shipping & Receiving. Cross-Delivery Handling Units

With this feature, you can use cross-delivery handling units (HUs) in the outbound process with Advanced Shipping and Receiving. The deliveries that are packed together must fulfill several conditions. The system runs the checks when you set the status of the delivery to Ready for Shipping, or in the case of immediate loading, when you set the status of the HUs to Packed for Shipping.

The cross-delivery HUs must meet the following conditions in SAP EWM:

  • All the deliveries involved must have transportation planning type E or F
  • All deliveries have the same ship-to party
  • Either all the deliveries are relevant for immediate loading or none of them are
  • You must set the status Ready for Shipping for all the outbound delivery orders involved in the cross-delivery network at the same time. The checks on all HUs or deliveries must be OK to set the status.
  • All the deliveries involved must have status Picking Completed before you set the status Ready for Shipping.

Transportation Management performs checks for shipping points, loading points, doors, and other transport related attributes on the cross-delivery HUs. For more information, see Integration of Cross-Delivery Handling Units in Advanced Shipping and Receiving.

You can use cross-delivery HUs in the warehouse driven process (transportation type E) and the transport driven process (transportation type F)

If you are using immediate loading, you can reverse the status Packed for Shipping for a cross-delivery HU if this HU is not yet loaded and Ready for Shipping is not set. You can reverse the status Ready for Shipping even if loading HUs has already started.

Harmonized Outbound Delivery Update in Logistics Execution

With this feature, we ensure that the changes in Logistic Execution process are harmonized across ERP Logistics Execution (LE), Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and Transportation Management (TM). For example:

  • You can change specific values of an outbound delivery in LE after the outbound delivery is distributed to EWM. Any changes you make in LE outbound delivery are automatically distributed to EWM and TM.
  • You can also add more items to an outbound delivery in LE after the delivery is distributed to EWM and freight units are created in TM.

In addition, some fields might be read-only in Change Outbound Delivery, depending on the warehouse processing status of the outbound delivery. For example, if the delivery has the status Ready for Warehouse Processing, some fields might not be editable in Change Outbound Delivery. To see the full list of the fields that are editable please read the Help Portal page ‚ÄúUpdating Outbound Deliveries in Logistics Execution‚Äù.

Enablement of Stock Transport Order Execution for the inbound process in embedded EWM

This feature enables you to process stock transport orders (STO) for sending and receiving warehouses in one Freight Order across EWM managed warehouses and non-EWM managed MM-IM storage locations, provided that embedded EWM/TM is used. Such STO enables the transfer of goods and materials from one plant to another within the same company code (intra-company).

In a two-step STO process, outbound and inbound deliveries are created, and the freight units (FU) are reassigned from the outbound to the inbound delivery. The posting of goods issue triggers the creation of an inbound delivery and the automatic reassignment of the FU from the outbound to the inbound delivery.

As soon as the FU is assigned the inbound delivery as its predecessor document, the receiving processes such as check-in, unloading and goods receipt can be processed.

This feature provides visibility throughout the end-to-end process ‚Äì from sending shipping point to receiving point within one business document. This feature is only available in embedded EWM and TM deployment.

New Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading

With this feature, we introduce a new execution status Cargo Ready for Loading, which, starts the creation of customs invoice and export declaration before the goods are loaded onto a truck in an Advanced Shipping and Receiving process.

The status is available on the freight order (FO) maintenance UI in Transportation Management (TM). When in use, you can set the status after the warehouse processing status is set to Completed. The status precedes handling execution status Loading Completed and can be configured as a prerequisite to customs documents requests. You can revert the status any time before the customs documents have been created.

Additionally, you can set up your system so that automatic consignment order creation happens when the status is set. Similarly, you can configure it so that the status triggers output processing such as the printing of transport documents or advanced shipping notifications (ASN). To find out more please read the Help Portal page ‚ÄúNew Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading‚Äù.

INTEGRATION

Integration is a core pillar of our investments, by which we provide a deep and native integration with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud solution components, along with SAP's cloud offerings for seamless integration of comprehensive logistics end-to-end processes incl. production integration, dangerous goods handling, customs processing and more. To that end, in this release we deliver the following enhancements.

Partial Goods Issue for Component Consumption & COGI split

With this feature, if you use synchronous goods movements for the consumption of components by manufacturing, you can split the goods issue for components consumed from EWM-managed storage locations if less than the full quantity needed is available on the production staging area (PSA). The system posts the goods issue for the available quantities and posts the remaining quantity to the Reprocess Goods Movements app (COGI). This feature is only available in embedded EWM.

The following restrictions apply to the COGI-split available with SAP S/4HANA 2025, FPS0:

  • You can't use this feature to split goods issue for components that require serial numbers.
  • You can't use this feature to split goods issue for batch-managed components.

To split goods issue quantities, you must activate it in one of the following Customizing activities:

  • For Repetitive Manufacturing, in Customizing for Production under Repetitive Manufacturing > Control > Define Repetitive Manufacturing Profiles
  • For Discrete Manufacturing, in Customizing for Production under Shop Floor Control > Master Data > Define Production Scheduling Profile for Discrete Manufacturing
  • For Process Manufacturing, in Customizing for Production Planning for Process Industries under Process Order > Master Data > Define Production Scheduling Profile for Process Manufacturing

EWM/QM Serial Number Integration

This feature enables you to record a quality inspection result for a specific serialized product in the Quality Management (QM) component of SAP S/4HANA by recording a usage decision for the serialized product with reference to its serial number. The system integrates the serial number to the inspection lot in the QM component during the goods receipt posting of the stock item. Note that this feature is available only for inspection object type (IOT) Q-Inspection Product/Batch Inbound Del. (IOT 4) and Q-Inspection Product/Batch Whse-Internal (IOT 5).

To enable this feature, you select the checkbox Serial No. Integr. (Enable Serial Number Integration) for IOT 4 or IOT 5 in Customizing for Extended Warehouse Management under Cross-Process Settings > Quality Management > Basics and Integration > Define and Activate Warehouse-Dependent IOTs.

For more information on recording a quality inspection result for a specific serialized product in the Quality Management (QM) component of SAP S/4HANA, please read the Help Portal page ‚ÄúSerial Numbers in Inspection Results‚Äù.

Deactivation of Quality Inspections Based on Movement Type

With this feature, you can deactivate quality inspections for inspection object type (IOT) Q-Inspection Product/Batch Inbound Del. (IOT 4) based on movement type settings in the Quality Management (QM) component of SAP S/4HANA. If the quality inspections are deactivated, the system doesn‚Äôt create an inspection request (inspection document or inspection lot).

The inspection process in EWM must be integrated with the QM component.

  • The QM component is in SAP S/4HANA 2025 or later.
  • You‚Äôve deactivated quality inspections for the movement type in Customizing for Quality Management under Quality Inspection > Inspection Lot Creation > Inspection for Goods Movement.
  • You‚Äôve deactivated quality inspections for IOT 4 based on movement type settings in the QM component.

To do this, you select the checkbox QM Deact. MvmtTyp (Deactivate Inspections Based on QM Movement Type Settings) in Customizing for Extended Warehouse Management under Cross-Process Settings > Quality Management > Basics and Integration > Define and Activate Warehouse-Dependent IOTs. For additional information, please consult the Help Portal page ‚ÄúDeactivation of Quality Inspections Based On Movement Type‚Äù.

SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP Batch Release Hub for Life Sciences integration

Support the integration of SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP Batch Release Hub for Life Sciences for both embedded and decentralized extended warehouse management.

The following integration scenarios are provided for SAP Batch Release Hub for Life Science integration:

  • Read the handling units with inspection lots from SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP Batch Release Hub for Life Sciences.
  • Stock the posting from SAP Batch Release Hub for Life Sciences to SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition based on inspection decision on handling units.

Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With this feature, you can integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with decentralized SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

You can use this integration if you want to start a business process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition but also want to use features that are available only in decentralized EWM based on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn more about integration aspects and supported features via our SAP blog  

The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Integration and the Knowledge Base Article ‚Äú3376453 - SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS00, FPS01, FPS02 and FPS03: Release information and restrictions for EWM in SAP S/4HANA‚Äù.

EXTENSIBILITY & USABILITY

The Clean Core Extensibility strategy aims to provide a modern and powerful integration option for customers and partners. Alongside supporting this strategy, we continuously adapt solution content to modernize and simplify the user experience. By regularly updating and refining SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition, we ensure we remain relevant and effective in meeting current needs. This year‚Äôs October release we deliver the following updates.

Monitor, RFUI, Interfaces enhancements

  • Warehouse Order Splitting in the Pick by Cart App - With this feature, you can use the Pick by Cart app to split a warehouse order when you've only partially completed a picking task. If you need to leave the warehouse order with only some items picked, you can choose to first unload the handling unit at its destination location and automatically split the warehouse order or just split the warehouse order. This helps you to more efficiently hand over the picking task to another warehouse worker.

  • Screen Zooming on Radio Frequency Devices - With this feature, you can enable zooming of radio frequency (RF) screens on presentation devices when using SAP GUI for HTML. For example, you can enable automatic zooming or fixed factor zooming of between 50 and 300 percent. You use zooming to fit RF screens to the display of the presentation device as well as possible. For more information please read the Help Portal page ‚ÄúScreen Zooming on Radio Frequency Devices‚Äù.

API updates: ODATA Services

  •  Posting changes in Physical Stock - With this feature you can perform several posting changes for the stock in your warehouse. You can make the following changes to the stock:
    • Change the stock type
    • Change the party entitled to dispose
    • Change product or batch
    • Change sales order or project reference
    • Change stock owner and usage

  • Visibility of Custom Fields in OData APIs ‚Äì With this feature, you can use the Custom Fields app to make your custom fields appear in the OData APIs Warehouse Inbound Delivery and Warehouse Outbound Delivery Order, if your custom fields also appear in the business contexts Warehouse Request Header or Warehouse Request Item. You still use the Custom Fields app to add custom fields to Warehouse Request Header and Warehouse Inbound Delivery.
  • Warehouse Order Business Events ‚Äì With this feature, the Warehouse Order business object triggers the following events when processing the warehouse tasks of a warehouse order:
    • Warehouse task created
    • Warehouse task confirmed
    • Warehouse task canceled
    • Warehouse task activated

Events are not triggered retroactively for existing warehouse orders and warehouse tasks. Events for warehouse tasks are triggered only when new warehouse tasks are processed or changes are made to existing warehouse orders and warehouse tasks (for example, a confirmation or cancellation).

API updates: Internal API

  • Enhancements to Goods Movements in EWM and Inventory Management ‚Äì With this feature, you can now use the application programming interface (API) API for Goods Movement in EWM and IM (/SCWM/IF_API_IM_GOODSMVT) to post goods receipt with reference to purchase order items (standard and stock transfer items), order items, and their reversals. The API enables you to post goods movements (goods receipts, goods issues, transfer postings, and their reversals) in Inventory Management and Extended Warehouse Management for embedded warehouses. The new goods movements can be posted for unpacked or packed items, including nested and mixed handling units (HUs). These goods movements are posted to the warehouse and to Inventory Management at the same time using movement type 101 or 102, or your own movement type that has been created as a copy of these movement types. For more information on these enhancements, please read the Help Portal page linked here.

CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENTS

Our commitment to modernization and continuous improvements not only enhances functionality but also provides users with a seamless and intuitive interaction, helping businesses drive efficiency, optimize processes, and deliver superior experiences to their stakeholders. To that end, I would like to highlight the following feature.

Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Putaway for Stock from External Procurement

With this feature, you can also reverse goods receipt for stock from external procurement even after final putaway. The reversal is available in the warehouse monitor, as the Reverse after Putaway method in the nodes for physical stocks, for example, Stock and Bin > Physical Stock.

You can also use the API interface /SCWM/IF_API_RVS_STOCK_PTWY in a custom development to perform the reversal. If you are using decentralized SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition, and your processes use Logistics Execution (LE) deliveries, you must set the Control Process: Extended Reversal After Final Putaway field to Allow for Completed LE Delivery in Customizing for Extended Warehouse Management under Interfaces > ERP Integration > ERP Integration for Decentralized EWM > Set Control Parameters for ERP Version Control.

The Business Add-In (BAdI) Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Putaway (External Procurement) allows you to implement additional checks at reversal of goods receipt after final putaway. See Customizing for Extended Warehouse Management under Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Extended Warehouse Management > Cross-Process Settings > Goods Movement Postings > BAdI: Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Putaway.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN WAREHOUSE MANAGEMENT

Predictive Labor Demand Planning

With the SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03 release, we delivered the foundation of predictive labor demand planning (LDP) that we‚Äôve been able to predict planned workload on Outbound Delivery Order and Warehouse Order/Warehouse Task level based on historical data collected from RF Picking and Packing activities. With this release, you can now use machine learning empowered workload forecast to anticipate future labor needs for better operational planning and resource allocation. The solution uses a minimum of 3 weeks of historical data and predicts the short-term labor demand in next days or weeks. Using SAP Smart Business dashboards, it gives insights of workload duration, calculated Full-time-equivalents (FTE) and other important aspects such as volume, weight, and number of expected items. The feature also takes factory calendar into consideration and offers extensibility possibilities that allow customers to influence on forecast calculations, making the solution adaptable to various warehouse environments.

Joule Navigation & Integration to the Warehouse Outbound Process

There is more to discuss regarding AI features available to EWM this year, but as the Joule development and release schedule has a different cadence to our regular mainline developments and releases, we feel that this topic deserves its own separate blog post. We will revisit later this fall and discuss more details on how Joule can assist both new and seasoned warehouse operators alike in navigating to required documents and FIORI apps, as well as help them throughout the warehouse outbound process. Stay tuned for more.

FIND OUT MORE!

To see more details on the above-mentioned topics as well as see what other enhancements we delivered with this release, I highly encourage you to explore our latest ‚ÄúSAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition‚Äù slide deck.

You can also find more technical details and documentation on the above listed topic and others we left out via the ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New‚Äù viewer on the Help Documentation portal.

For more information about SAP Extended Warehouse Management, please follow us on social media, our YouTube channel or our community pages:

SAP EWM Community

SAP YouTube Channel

EWM LinkedIn Community

SAP Extended Warehouse Management Roadmap Explorer

Release information and restrictions of embedded EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2025 

Release information and restrictions of Decentralized EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2025 

For a complete list of Q&A from the EWM community, please access this link:
https://answers.sap.com/tags/01200615320800000705

In case you do not find your specific question there, feel free to post your question via the following form:
https://answers.sap.com/questions/ask.html?primaryTagId=01200615320800000705

entry.title: SAPUI5 TreeTable: Expand All Children of Selected Nodes
entry.content:
Introduction

When working with the SAPUI5 TreeTable, one common requirement is to let users expand nodes beyond just the first level. For example, you may want to expand all children of a selected node, and continue expanding until you reach the deepest leaf level.

The standard SAPUI5 TreeTable API gives us some basic expand/collapse options like expandToLevel() or expanding only specific row index, but there‚Äôs no direct way to say:

üëâüèº‚ÄúTake these selected nodes and expand everything under them, no matter how many levels deep.‚Äù

That‚Äôs exactly the problem I ran into.

To solve this, I built a solution where all selected nodes are expanded recursively until their leaf nodes are visible. The logic works with JSON models (and technically also with OData if you load all hierarchy data upfront ‚Äî with the usual performance caveats).

Here‚Äôs a quick demo of the feature in action üëáüèº

Recursive expansion ensures all children are opened ‚Äî no matter how deep the hierarchy goes.

 At first, I assumed there must be a ready-made API for this ‚Äî but there isn‚Äôt. So, I decided to build a small recursive helper to achieve this behavior. In this blog, I‚Äôll share how I extended the official TreeTable sample to add this functionality.

Why This Is Useful

TreeTables are often used for things like:

  • Product catalogs

  • Bill of Materials (BOM)

  • Organizational hierarchies

And in all these cases, users don‚Äôt just want to expand one level at a time ‚Äî they often want to open everything under a node they‚Äôre interested in.

My Approach

The standard TreeTable APIs include:

  • collapseAll()

  • expandToLevel(level)

  • expand(rowIndex)

They don‚Äôt include a ‚Äúrecursive expand‚Äù option. So, I wrote a helper function _expandRecursive that expands a node and then walks through all of its children, expanding them one by one.

When recursively expanding multiple selected nodes, the row indices of nodes can change if we start expanding from the top, because expanding a node inserts its child rows and shifts the indices of the rows below it. To prevent this from breaking the expansion of other selected nodes, I sort the selected indices in descending order and expand from the last selected row upwards. Within each node, child nodes are then expanded recursively. The tiny async delay ensures that the TreeTable has time to fully process each expansion before moving to the next child, maintaining correct indexing and avoiding skipped nodes.

Implementation

Controller (CatalogHierarchy.controller.js)

Here‚Äôs the core of the solution ‚Äî notice the onExpandAllLevelsForSelection method and the _expandRecursive helper:

sap.ui.define([
    "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller"
], (Controller) => {
    "use strict";

    return Controller.extend("openui5.treetable.recursiveexpand.controller.CatalogHierarchy", {
        onInit() {
        },

         // Collapse all nodes
		onCollapseAll: function() {
			const oTreeTable = this.byId("TreeTableBasic");
			oTreeTable.collapseAll();
		},

        // Collapse only selected nodes
		onCollapseSelection: function() {
			const oTreeTable = this.byId("TreeTableBasic");
			oTreeTable.collapse(oTreeTable.getSelectedIndices());
		},

        // Expand first-level nodes for the entire tree
		onExpandFirstLevelForAll: function() {
			const oTreeTable = this.byId("TreeTableBasic");
			oTreeTable.expandToLevel(1);
		},

        // Expand first-level nodes only for selected entries
		onExpandFirstLevelForSelection: function() {
			const oTreeTable = this.byId("TreeTableBasic");
			oTreeTable.expand(oTreeTable.getSelectedIndices());
		},

        // Expand all levels recursively for selected nodes
        onExpandAllevelsForSelection: function() {
            const oTreeTable = this.byId("TreeTableBasic");
            oTreeTable.setBusyIndicatorDelay(0).setBusy(true);

            const aSelectedIndices = oTreeTable.getSelectedIndices().sort((a, b) => b - a);
		
			// Use a chain of promises to execute the expansion sequentially
			let chain = Promise.resolve();
		
			aSelectedIndices.forEach(function (iIndex) {
				chain = chain.then(function () {
					return this._expandRecursive(oTreeTable, iIndex); // Return a promise from _expandRecursive
				}.bind(this));
			}.bind(this));
		
			chain.then(function () {
				console.log("All selected nodes and their children have been expanded.");
			}).catch(function (error) {
				console.error("Error expanding nodes:", error);
			}).finally(function () {
				oTreeTable.setBusy(false);
			});
		},
		
        /**
         * Recursive function to expand a node and all of its children.
         *  {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} oTreeTable - The TreeTable instance
         *  {int} iIndex - Index of the node to expand
         * @returns {Promise}
         */
		_expandRecursive: function (oTreeTable, iIndex) {
			oTreeTable.expand(iIndex);
		
			const oContext = oTreeTable.getContextByIndex(iIndex);
			if (!oContext) {
				return Promise.resolve();
			}
		
			const iChildCount = oTreeTable.getBinding("rows").getChildCount(oContext);
			let chain = Promise.resolve();
		
			// Process child nodes in reverse order
			for (let i = iChildCount - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
				chain = chain.then(function () {
					const iChildIndex = iIndex + 1 + i;
					return this._asyncDelay(0) // Delay using promises
						.then(() => this._expandRecursive(oTreeTable, iChildIndex));
				}.bind(this));
			}
		
			return chain; // Return the promise chain
		},
		
		/**
         * Helper function to introduce async delay
         *  {int} ms - delay in milliseconds
         * @returns {Promise}
         */
		_asyncDelay: function (ms) {
			return new Promise(function (resolve) {
				setTimeout(resolve, ms);
			});
		}
    });
});

View (CatalogHierarchy.view.xml)

<mvc:View controllerName="openui5.treetable.recursiveexpand.controller.CatalogHierarchy"
        xmlns="sap.ui.table"
        xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
        xmlns:m="sap.m"
        xmlns:u="sap.ui.unified"
        xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
        height="100%">
    <m:Page
            showHeader="false"
            enableScrolling="false">
        <m:content>
            <TreeTable
                    id="TreeTableBasic"
                    rows="{path:'/catalog/clothing', parameters: {arrayNames:['categories']}}"
                    selectionMode="MultiToggle"
                    enableSelectAll="true"
                    ariaLabelledBy="title">
                <extension>
                    <m:OverflowToolbar style="Clear">
                        <m:Title id="title" text="Clothing"/>
                        <m:ToolbarSpacer/>
                        <m:Button text="Collapse all" press="onCollapseAll"/>
                        <m:Button text="Collapse selection" press="onCollapseSelection"/>
                        <m:Button text="Expand first level for all" press="onExpandFirstLevelForAll"/>
                        <m:Button text="Expand first level for selection" press="onExpandFirstLevelForSelection"/>
                        <m:Button text="Expand all levels for selection" press="onExpandAllevelsForSelection" type="Emphasized"/>
                    </m:OverflowToolbar>
                </extension>
                <columns>
                    <Column width="13rem">
                        <m:Label text="Categories"/>
                        <template>
                            <m:Text text="{name}" wrapping="false" />
                        </template>
                    </Column>
                    <Column width="9rem">
                        <m:Label text="Price"/>
                        <template>
                            <u:Currency value="{amount}" currency="{currency}"/>
                        </template>
                    </Column>
                    <Column width="11rem">
                        <m:Label text="Size"/>
                        <template>
                            <m:Select
                                    items="{path: '/sizes', templateShareable: true}"
                                    selectedKey="{size}"
                                    visible="{= !!${size}}"
                                    forceSelection="false">
                                <core:Item key="{key}" text="{value}"/>
                            </m:Select>
                        </template>
                    </Column>
                </columns>
            </TreeTable>
        </m:content>
    </m:Page>
</mvc:View>

Things to Watch Out For

  • Works only if the hierarchy is fully loaded (JSON model, or preloaded OData).

  • Won‚Äôt work with lazy loading via navigation.

  • Be careful with very large datasets ‚Äî expanding thousands of nodes recursively can impact performance.

Wrap Up

This helper solved a real problem for me and might help you if you‚Äôre working with hierarchical data in a TreeTable. It‚Äôs simple, effective, and can be adapted to your use case.

Feel free to fork the repo or leave feedback in the comments!

üì¶Source Code: GitHub Repository
üåêLive Demo: Try it out here

entry.title: Migration object for lease contracts
entry.content:
Dear Sir or Madame,

The question is related to Lease in Accounting 1T6/21P.

Based on the following information there is no migration object existing and the contracts must be manually entered into SAP.

Solved: Migration of Lease In contract in S4 Public cloud - SAP Community

2544232 - Leasing: Handling transition scenarios - SAP for Me

 

Is this manual process still the case?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Migration object for lease contracts
entry.content:
Thank you for your question!

I am happy to confirm, that there are several migration objects available for Contract and Lease Management which you can review on the SAP Help Portal. One of these migration objects is specifically for 'Real Estate Contracts', for which you can check the technical details on the relevant Help Portal page as well.

Nonetheless, KBA 2544232 - Leasing: Handling transition scenarios - SAP for Me that you have also highlighted remains a good resource on the actual settings of specific contracts, depending on the migration approach taken.

entry.title: Business Transformation Management Value Map Has Moved to SAP Community
entry.content:
We‚Äôd like to share some important news regarding SAP ENTERPRISE SUPPORT - BUSINESS TRANSFORMATION MANAGEMENT VALUE MAP

 

What is Business Transformation Management Value Map?

the value map is your structured guide to exploring, onboarding, adopting and effectively using SAP LeanIX and SAP Signavio solutions. It connects you with curated learning content, expert insights, and tailored recommendations. Whether you're looking to build skills, streamline operations, or drive continuous innovation, the Value Map offers practical tools, value accelerators, and hands-on advisory services to help you succeed.


Best of all, access to the Value Map is included in your SAP LeanIX and/or SAP Signavio subscription at no extra cost!!!

 

To provide an even better experience, We have moved to a new home on SAP Community!

What does this mean for you?

  • Easier access ‚Äì no more switching between SAP platforms.
  • More connected experience ‚Äì collaborate directly with peers and SAP experts in SAP Community.
  • Same trusted features ‚Äì including curated content, guided learning paths, and the Request a Call option to connect with our experts.

 

What you need to do

üëâSimply visit our new SAP Community page for more information and to get access.

To access the Business Transformation Management Value Map Group, you must login to SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID.

Then click ‚ÄúJoin Group.‚Äù

‚û°Ô∏è Watch our short demo video

 

Don‚Äôt Miss Value Maps on SAP Community Live Session!

Join our live session to explore Value Maps on SAP Community:

üé• Live Session: SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps ‚Äì Our Move to SAP Community

Can‚Äôt make it? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì a replay will be available.

 

About the author:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

Petr Venhuda is the Portfolio Manager and Topic Expert of SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in‚ÄØBusiness Transformation Management and Business Process Improvement. With‚ÄØ18‚ÄØyears of experience at SAP and a background spanning roles in‚ÄØCustomer Service & Delivery, Petr is passionate about helping customers succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings.
